Package com.bluegosling.concurrent.fluent Description

This package contains the Ã¼ber-Future. It is an extension of the Future interface that allows completion callbacks to be registered. This means code has the flexibility of either doing things asynchronously with callbacks or synchronously by blocking for the future to complete. It also provides numerous other new methods to greatly improve the ease of use of futures.

This API is similar in key ways to Guava's ListenableFuture. Also, it is similar to the new CompletionStage interface added in Java 8. This version attempts to combine the best of both, and thus draws heavy inspiration from both. The key differences follow:

  1. Like CompletionStage, this future includes a very wide, fluent API for chaining and monad-like use. Thanks to Java 8's default methods, the surface area that concrete implementations need to provide is much smaller and is closer to that of ListenableFuture.
  2. Its API uses method names that are more consistent with Stream than the methods of CompletionStage or the utility methods in Guava's Futures API.
  3. Unlike CompletionStage, it extends Future, thus providing methods for blocking until completion. It also provides additional APIs around awaiting completion.
  4. It provides numerous new accessors to make inspecting the disposition of a completed future much simpler. It also provides a visitor pattern, as a new idiom for interacting with a future (that is similar in many respects to Guava's Futures.addCallback.
